III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
facility had only one required CAP during this reporting period. This involved a
special investigation (2025SIC0001432) in which the facility was found in non-
compliance when staff failed to follow the incident reporting procedure. A CAP
was required and the approved CAP involved two action steps involving training
all staff on incident reporting and individual training for the staff involved. The
CAP was approved on 7/9/24 and reviewed four times during quarterly on-site
inspections. The CAP was closed on 1/7/25 as documentation of all action was
reviewed. All employees had been retrained and the staff involved received 1:1
training. No other CAP was required during this review period.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit and letter from their auditor.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator documents the facility is in compliance with the licensing
rules, ISEP, and contact and these issues are being reviewed in staff meetings.
She also documents meeting with individual staff to discuss rules if needed. It is
documented there was one special investigation (2025SIC0001432) during this
reporting period and a CAP was developed. The facility was found in non-
compliance when three staff failed to follow the procedure for incident reporting.
This finding resulted in a CAP being developed which includes the following action
steps. All staff will be trained on the incident reporting procedures and the staff

involved will received additional 1:1 training on incident reporting procedures along
with chain of command. The Chief Administrator documents these action steps
have been completed with one of the staff involved no longer being employed at
the facility. All of the achievements on the action steps were verified and
documented. She also documents there were no unplanned discharges during this
review period and all policies and procedures were reviewed between February
2025 and May 2025 with no further revisions being made.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported a strong desire to be helpful and supportive to the
youth. All reported enjoying this type of program with the problems that the youth
present and the staff believed they are helping the youth gain new skills. All the
staff interviewed reported adjusting well to the new management team.
Administration staff interviewed reported the new management team is supportive
and engaged in supporting the line staff with training and positive interactions.
Three of the five youth were interviewed because they had enough verbal skills
(still very limited) to understand the questions. They reported feeling safe and well
cared for at the facility. The interactions between staff and the youth were
observed and staff were very attentive to the youth. Staff’s interactions were
positive and in a helping manner.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is a single-story home in a residential location northeast of Kalamazoo,
The facility is furnished appropriately and all items required to be posted were
found to be posted. All plumbing was in working order and cleaning supplies were
locked. The medication is also locked, and medication logs were up to date. The
fire drill logs were appropriate along with bedroom checks. The menu was posted
and there was a significant amount of food (fresh, frozen, and dry) available in the
kitchen. The building is in good repair.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
